numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The largest percentage of young people is between 50% and 75%.
2. These young people contact their parents at least once a day or a few times a week.
3. The smallest percentage of young people is between 15% and 25%.
4. These young people visit their parents in person.
5. There is a relatively large disparity between young men and young women in communication habits.
6. Women are 20% more likely than men to send texts to their parents.
7. Women are 20% more likely than men to do video-chats with their parents.
8. I wonder if more young people contact their parents via text because text is less time-intensive.
9. I wonder if more young people contact their parents via video-chat because video-chat is less time-intensive.
10. I wonder how the data is divided by age.
11. Gen Z is a group of young people.
12. I wonder if Gen Z young people are more likely to use technology to contact their parents.
13. I am curious if women are more likely to contact their parents because of societal expectations.
14. I am curious if women are more likely to contact their parents because women are expected to be caregivers.
15. I will not always live near my parents.
16. If I do not live near my parents then I cannot always see my parents at home.
17. If I do not live near my parents then I must contact my parents to maintain contact.
18. The data indicates a shift in communication methods.
19. Technology is an increasingly important means to connect.
20. The headline is: Send a Wire: More Female than Male?
